Perusahaan Telekomunikasi Kian Bergantung pada Layanan Data
01 Nov 2019, 09:23 by Ai Rika Rachmawati
BANDUNG, (PR).- Layanan data menjadi pendorong utama pendapatan dan laba perusahaan telekomunikasi pada triwulan III/2019 ini. Pendapatan data sudah mampu mengimbangi penurunan pendapatan dari layanan konvensional, voice dan SMS.
Pada truwulan III/2019 PT Telkom Indonesia (Persero), Tbk. membukukan laba bersih sebesar Rp 16,5 triliun, naik 15,6% dibanding periode sama tahun sebelumnya (year on year/yoy). Sementara pendapatan tercatat mencapai Rp102,6 triliun atau tumbuh 3,5%.
Sementara itu, PT XL Axiata, Tbk. mencatatkan laba bersih yang telah dinormalisasi sebesar Rp 505 miliar pada periode Januari-September 2019. Pada periode tersebut XL membukukan pertumbuhan pendapatan sebesar 11% yoy.
Direktur Keuangan Telkom, Harry M. Zen, mengatakan, bisnis digital, data, dan  teknologi informasi (TI) yang terus tumbuh menjadi pendorong utama pendapatan dan laba Telkom. Pada periode tersebut Telkom juga berhasil menekan biaya operasional perusahaan.
"Ini menggambarkan bahwa kinerja perseroan semakin sehat dan profitable," kata Harry, dalam keterangannya di Jakarta, Kamis, 31 Oktober 2019.
Harry mengatakan, pendapatan data, internet, dan layanan TI menjadi penyumbang terbesar pendapatan perseroan, dengan nilai kontribusi sebesar 59,1%. Menurut dia, pendapatan data, internet, dan layanan TI Telkom tumbuh sebesar 17,8% dibanding periode yang sama tahun lalu, menjadi Rp 60,6 triliun. 
"Lonjakan kontribusi tersebut terutama didorong kinerja bisnis mobile digital broadband dan layanan IndiHome yang terus meningkat," katanya.
Di tengah industri telekomunikasi yang kompetitif, menurut Harry, Telkomsel selaku entitas anak usaha Telkom membukukan pendapatan sebesar Rp 68,3 triliun. EBITDA margin Telkomsel juga tercatat relatif stabil, sebesar 53,8%.
Jumlah pelanggan Telkomsel pada kuartal III/2019 mencapai 170,9 juta atau naik 167,8 juta pelanggan yoy. Sebanyak 65,6% di antaranya, atau 112,1 juta, merupakan pelanggan data. 
"Ini membuat trafik data pun meningkat 55,2% menjadi 4.673 petabyte," tutur Harry.
Sementara itu, pendapatan IndiHome meningkat 52,1% yoy, menjadi Rp13,7 triliun. Dari sisi operasional, dengan tambahan 1,4 juta pelanggan baru selama 2019, total pelanggan IndiHome pada akhir September 2019 menjadi 6,5 juta atau tumbuh 38,3% yoy.
XLSementara itu, Presiden Direktur XL Axiata, Dian Siswarini, mengatakan, pada triwulan III/2019 pendapatan XL tumbuh 3% dibandingkan triwulan sebelumnya. XL juga mengatakan bahwa pertumbuhan positif kinerna pendapatan dan laba XL ditunjang oleh layanan data.
"Kenaikan pendapatan layanan data XL pada triwulan III/2019 ini mencapai 30% yoy," tuturnya.
Selain lonjakan pendapatan data, menurut dia, pada periode tersebut XL juga berhasil meningkatkan efisiensi perseroan. EBITDA XL melonjak 19% yoy.
"Bersama dengan penerapan strategi 'dual brand', investasi pada perluasan jaringan data telah meningkatkan penetrasi pengguna smartphone menjadi sekitar 86% atau 47,7 juta dari total pelanggan XL," tuturnya.
Kondisi tersebut pada dilirannya mampu memperbesar kontribusi pendapatan layanan data menjadi 88% dari total pendapatan layanan perusahaan. Jumlah pengguna data naik menjadi 88% yoy dan 70% di antaranya menggunakan data 4G. 
"Pencapaian ini menempatkan perusahaan pada posisi yang lebih kuat dalam menghadapi dampak terus menurunnya pendapatan dari layanan tradisional," ujarnya.
Total jumlah pelanggan XL, menurut dia, juga meningkat menjadi 55,5 juta. Pada periode yang sama tahun lalu jumlahnya masih 53,9 juta pelanggan.
"Tingginya lonjakan pendapatan layanan data XL juga tidak terlepas dari strategi kami dalam memperkuat infrastruktut layanan data di luar Pulau Jawa. Strategi ini mampu mendongkrak pendapatan layanan data dari luar Jawa," kata Dian.***

Telecommunications Companies Increasingly Dependent on Data Services
Nov 01 2019, 09:23 by Ai Rika Rachmawati
BANDUNG, (PR) .- Data services became the main driver of telecommunication company revenue and profit in the third quarter of 2019. Data revenues have been able to offset the decline in revenue from conventional services, voice and SMS.
In the third quarter / 2019 PT Telkom Indonesia (Persero), Tbk. posted a net profit of Rp 16.5 trillion, up 15.6% compared to the same period the previous year (year on year / yoy). While revenue was recorded at IDR 102.6 trillion or grew by 3.5%.
Meanwhile, PT XL Axiata, Tbk. recorded a normalized net profit of Rp 505 billion in the January-September 2019 period. In that period XL posted a revenue growth of 11% yoy.
Telkom Finance Director, Harry M. Zen, said that digital business, data and information technology (IT) which continues to grow become the main driver of Telkom's revenue and profit. In that period Telkom also succeeded in reducing the company's operational costs.
"This illustrates that the company's performance is increasingly healthy and profitable," said Harry, in his statement in Jakarta, Thursday, October 31, 2019.
Harry said that data, internet and IT service revenues were the largest contributors to the company's revenue, with a contribution of 59.1 percent. According to him, Telkom's data, internet and IT services revenue grew by 17.8% compared to the same period last year, to Rp 60.6 trillion.
"The surge in contributions was mainly driven by the performance of the mobile digital broadband business and IndiHome services which continue to increase," he said.
In the midst of a competitive telecommunications industry, according to Harry, Telkomsel as a subsidiary of Telkom posted revenues of Rp 68.3 trillion. Telkomsel's EBITDA margin was also relatively stable, at 53.8%.
The number of Telkomsel subscribers in the third quarter of 2019 reached 170.9 million or an increase of 167.8 million yoy customers. A total of 65.6% of them, or 112.1 million, are data customers.
"This makes the data traffic also increase by 55.2% to 4,673 petabytes," said Harry.
Meanwhile, IndiHome's revenue increased 52.1% yoy, to Rp13.7 trillion. From an operational standpoint, with an additional 1.4 million new customers in 2019, IndiHome's total customers at the end of September 2019 became 6.5 million or grew 38.3% yoy.
XL Meanwhile, President Director of XL Axiata, Dian Siswarini, said that in the third quarter of 2019 XL's revenue grew 3% compared to the previous quarter. XL also said that the positive growth of XL's revenue and profit growth was supported by data services.
"The increase in XL's data service revenue in the third quarter of 2019 reached 30% yoy," he said.
In addition to the surge in data revenues, according to him, in that period XL also succeeded in increasing the company's efficiency. XL EBITDA jumped 19% yoy.
"Together with the implementation of the 'dual brand' strategy, investment in data network expansion has increased smartphone user penetration to around 86% or 47.7 million of the total XL customers," he said.
This condition in its dilution was able to increase data service revenue contribution to 88% of the company's total service revenue. The number of data users rose to 88% yoy and 70% of them used 4G data.
"This achievement places the company in a stronger position in the face of the continued decline in revenue from traditional services," he said.
The total number of XL customers, according to him, also increased to 55.5 million. In the same period last year the number was 53.9 million subscribers.
"The high jump in XL data service revenues is also inseparable from our strategy in strengthening data service infrastructure outside of Java. This strategy is able to boost data service revenues from outside Java," Dian said. ***
